result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlton Everette Benion

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carlton Everette Benion in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Carlton Everette Benion.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call. Court cancels the stayed warrant. Defense in receipt of discovery and an offer. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Carlton Everette Benion not in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Carlton Everette Benion.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court grants defense counsel's request to appear by Zoom.
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 30.
Calendar call scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlton Everette Benion in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Carlton Everette Benion.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense will receive discovery and offer upon Defense filing a formal notice of appearance and will need time to review. Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Carlton Everette Benion in court.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Allison Ritter to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing at the close of the case.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Case adjourned in Branch 10.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlton Everette Benion not in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for further proceedings. Defendant appeared on Zoom for a brief moment. Court will set an in-person hearing. 
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlton Everette Benion not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant may be in custody, and case is rescheduled to determine status of defendant. 
Case adjourned.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Carlton Everette Benion in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Carlton Everette Benion in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carlton Everette Benion appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
